derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French equinoxe or Latin aequinoctium, from aequi- 'equal' + nox, noct- 'night'

encyclopedia.content: 英语 Equinox（名词） 读音：[e – kw – naks] 词义 1：（1）一年中白天和黑夜的长度相同的日子，这种天一年内有两个。（2）在地球上看来，太阳轨道穿越赤道并与其交汇的两个点。 用法 1：一共有两个昼夜平分点：春分点和秋分点。春分点，也就是北半球传统上的春季开始的第一天，出现在当天东部标准时间的凌晨 1 时 49 分。复活节就是春分点后的第一个满月后的第一个星期日，这也就是它不像圣诞节那样有固定的日期的原因。如果你

entry.tran: 二分时刻，昼夜平分日（指春分或秋分）
entry.def: An equinox is one of the two days in the year when day and night are of equal length.

example.ex: In the Chinese calendar, the Spring Equinox always occurs in the second month.
example.tran: 在中国历法中，春分总是出现在2月。

means.word_mean: 1. either of two times of the year when the sun crosses the plane of the earth's equator and day and night are of equal length
2. (astronomy) either of the two celestial points at which the celestial equator intersects the ecliptic
